intro: Alangium gracile, commonly known as slender sandarac, is a small evergreen shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. Alangium gracile is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its botanical features make it a valuable component of tropical and subtropical ecosystems.
